segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: This week, we've got many articles from the React and React-Native community, and the latest Expo Launch Party announcements. Some articles are very long, and I didn't have time to read them all.

segments.content: Stream is the maker of enterprise-gradeÂ **APIs**Â andÂ **SDKs**Â that help product and engineering teams solve two common problems at scale: in-app chat and social activity feeds.
segments.sourceMdx: Stream is the maker of enterprise-gradeÂ **APIs**Â andÂ **SDKs**Â that help product and engineering teams solve two common problems at scale: in-app chat and social activity feeds.

segments.content: With Stream, developers can integrate any type of messaging or feed experience into their app in a fraction of the time it would take to build these features from scratch. Stream Chat makes it easy for developers to integrate rich, real-time messaging into their applications.
segments.sourceMdx: With Stream, developers can integrate any type of messaging or feed experience into their app in a fraction of the time it would take to build these features from scratch. Stream Chat makes it easy for developers to integrate rich, real-time messaging into their applications.

segments.content:
Stream provides robust client-side SDKs for popular frameworks such asÂ [**React**](https://getstream.io/chat/sdk/react/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=sponsorship\&utm_content=\&utm_campaign=thisweekinreact_July2023_video_klmh22),Â [**React-Native**](https://getstream.io/chat/sdk/react-native/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=sponsorship\&utm_content=\&utm_campaign=thisweekinreact_July2023_video_klmh22), Expo, Flutter, Android, Angular, Compose, Unreal, and iOS.

segments.content: ## âš›ï¸ React

segments.content: [![Can React Server Actions finally fix forms?](/emails/issues/156/serveractions.jpg)](https://www.mux.com/blog/what-are-react-server-actions)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Can React Server Actions finally fix forms?](/emails/issues/156/serveractions.jpg)](https://www.mux.com/blog/what-are-react-server-actions)

segments.content: [**Can React Server Actions finally fix forms?**](https://www.mux.com/blog/what-are-react-server-actions)
segments.sourceMdx: [**Can React Server Actions finally fix forms?**](https://www.mux.com/blog/what-are-react-server-actions)

segments.content: A great introduction to Server Actions, a forthcoming React feature that has already been integrated into Next.js 13.4 (experimental). Includes a short tutorial on uploading a video with a title. Server Actions can return a response to give feedback to the user, but it's clear that this isn't yet an ideal DX.
segments.sourceMdx: A great introduction to Server Actions, a forthcoming React feature that has already been integrated into Next.js 13.4 (experimental). Includes a short tutorial on uploading a video with a title. Server Actions can return a response to give feedback to the user, but it's clear that this isn't yet an ideal DX.

segments.content: In my opinion, Server Actions should aim to fully support progressive enhancement. This probably requires to introduce a "flash" API to manage feedback without any client-side JavaScript. This exists in many backend frameworks, and Remix offers a ([`session.flash()`](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/utils/sessions#sessionflashkey-value)) API. Related info that might interest you: with [`action.$$FORM_ACTION`](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1689921046856474625) you can extend React's progressive enhancement behavior.
segments.sourceMdx: In my opinion, Server Actions should aim to fully support progressive enhancement. This probably requires to introduce a "flash" API to manage feedback without any client-side JavaScript. This exists in many backend frameworks, and Remix offers a ([`session.flash()`](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/utils/sessions#sessionflashkey-value)) API. Related info that might interest you: with [`action.$$FORM_ACTION`](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1689921046856474625) you can extend React's progressive enhancement behavior.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Zero To Shipped - Master Fast-Paced Fullstack Development and **Finally** ship that product](https://www.zerotoshipped.com/)
* ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ“ [React.dev - Using TypeScript](https://react.dev/learn/typescript): new official documentation page.
* ğŸ’¬ [Next.js RFC - Google Tag Manager and gtag in next/third-parties](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions/53868): offers to integrate Google Analytics using a hook rather than a component, with possibly Web Worker support.
* ğŸ¦ [Million.js Automatic Mode - Video trailer](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1689773623827943424)
* ğŸ“œ [Things you forgot (or never knew) because of React](https://joshcollinsworth.com/blog/antiquated-react): a very long criticism of React, considered to be an outdated framework. It's still an interesting read, even if [I disagree](https://github.com/josh-collinsworth/joco-sveltekit/issues/35#issuecomment-1680817566) and think the author is unfair.
* ğŸ“œ [Fantastic closures and how to find them in React](https://www.developerway.com/posts/fantastic-closures): explains what a stale closure is in React and presents various cases that can introduce this problem, then proposes a solution based on `useRef()`.
* ğŸ“œ [The simplest example to understand Server Actions in Next.js](https://scastiel.dev/simplest-example-server-actions-nextjs): very simple Server Actions example, easy to understand, and providing a practical way of making RPC calls to your API.
* ğŸ“œ [On React Suspenseâ€™s throttling](https://andreigatej.dev/blog/on-react-suspense-throttling/): highlights a surprising behaviour of React when you nest `<Suspense>`.
* ğŸ“œ [Quit Your YAP-ing](https://kyleshevlin.com/quit-your-yapping): encourages you to abandon the "Yet-Another-Prop" syndrome and use composition instead.
* ğŸ“œ [Node.js's Config Hell Problem](https://deno.com/blog/node-config-hell): Deno's criticism of projects like Next.js, which often have dozens of configuration files.
* ğŸ“œ [Supabase - Vercel Integration and Next.js App Router Support](https://supabase.com/blog/using-supabase-with-vercel): an integration worth studying. Includes APIs with interesting names like `createClientComponentClient` ğŸ˜….
* ğŸ“œ [Lifting Off with Astro](https://remotesynthesis.com/blog/lifting-off-with-astro/)
* ğŸ“œ [Form Validation with React Hook Form](https://claritydev.net/blog/form-validation-react-hook-form)
* ğŸ“œ [Introducing a new lint rule for React Testing Library](https://blog.testdouble.com/posts/2023-07-31-a-new-rtl-lint-rule/)
* ğŸ“œ [How to Use Jotai and useTransition for Mutation](https://blog.axlight.com/posts/how-to-use-jotai-and-use-transition-for-mutation/)
* ğŸ“œ [Coding the stars - An interactive constellation with Three.js and React Three Fiber](https://supabase.com/blog/interactive-constellation-threejs-react-three-fiber)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Aria - August 9 Releases - HTML form submit/reset, DropZone, FileTrigger...](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2023-08-09.html)
* ğŸ“¦ [Natuerlich - Composable interactions for WebXR experiences - With React-Three-Fiber support](https://github.com/coconut-xr/natuerlich)
* ğŸ“¦ [Reakit - August 2023 update](https://newsletter.ariakit.org/p/all-things)
* ğŸ“¦ [Obsidiosaurus - Obsidian -> Docusaurus Converter](https://github.com/CIMSTA/obsidiosaurus)
* ğŸ“¦ [tw2panda - Easily migrate code from Tailwind to Panda CSS](https://github.com/astahmer/tw2panda)
* ğŸ¥ [Why I Stopped Using Next.js And Chose Astro Instead](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BoeZqPaYw9s)
* ğŸ¥ [Responsive Framer Motion with Tailwind CSS](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSuxsfn13xg)
* ğŸ¥ [Dominik Dorfmeister: React Query With The App Router](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R4NHXrvwZWA)

segments.content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native

segments.content: [![Expo Preview - Fully customizable builds on EAS Build](/emails/issues/156/easbuild.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/08-10-custom-builds)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Expo Preview - Fully customizable builds on EAS Build](/emails/issues/156/easbuild.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/08-10-custom-builds)

segments.content: [**Expo Preview - Fully customizable builds on EAS Build**](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/08-10-custom-builds).
segments.sourceMdx: [**Expo Preview - Fully customizable builds on EAS Build**](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/08-10-custom-builds).

segments.content: Expo has come up with a new system for EAS Build that allows you to customise the flow with a Yaml file, which should give you a lot of flexibility to use the monorepo tools of your choice (Nx, Turbo, Rush...) or add your own CI steps. It looks quite similar to GitHub Actions. TIL: it seems EAS is using Fastlane on iOS builds.
segments.sourceMdx: Expo has come up with a new system for EAS Build that allows you to customise the flow with a Yaml file, which should give you a lot of flexibility to use the monorepo tools of your choice (Nx, Turbo, Rush...) or add your own CI steps. It looks quite similar to GitHub Actions. TIL: it seems EAS is using Fastlane on iOS builds.
